The Mormon guy was making sure people were safe, which sounds like a positive action. Mormons are often seen as caring and responsible, so maybe his actions would go unnoticed or even be praised by the cops because they're doing something helpful.

On the other hand, the Atheist was trying to pick up drunk girls. This could be seen as inappropriate behavior, especially in a party setting. Since Atheists are labeled as scum and illogical, their actions might make them more likely to be caught or noticed for being out of line.

Additionally, frats typically stick together, so even if one is a Mormon and the other an Atheist, they would still be considered part of the same group because they're in the same frat. Therefore, both might be seen as troublemakers regardless of their individual beliefs.
